Package com.jjackb14.blissapbot.database

Class Database

java.lang.Object
com.jjackb14.blissapbot.database.Database
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Database extends Object implements Runnable
Manages the Database for BlissAPBot following the singleton design pattern.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Database()
    Creates a database object and creates the connection to the MySQL database.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Database getInstance()
      Gets the instance of the database.
      Returns:
      The instance of the database.

    • createConnection

      public void createConnection()
      Creates the connection to the database.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there are any issues connecting to the database.

    • insertData

      public void insertData(Player player)
      Adds a player to the database.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to be added.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there are any issues adding to the database.

    • removeData

      public boolean removeData(String user_name, String gamertag)
      Removes a player from the database based on their gamertag.
      Parameters:
      user_name - The players in game name.
      gamertag - The players gamertag.
      Returns:
      True if the player is removed and false if they are not.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there are any issues removing that player from the database.

    • getAllPlayers

      public ArrayList<Player> getAllPlayers()
      Gets all the players from the database and returns them in an ArrayList.
      Returns:
      All the players in the database.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there are any errors fetching players.

    • resetSeen

      public void resetSeen(String userName, String gamertag)
      Resets seenToday for a specific player.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username of the player to reset seenToday.
      gamertag - The gamertag of the player to reset seenToday.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there are any issues setting the field.

    • resetSeenToday

      public void resetSeenToday()
      Resets the seenToday value for all players to false.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there are any issues resetting the field.

    • run

      public void run()
      When an object implementing interface Runnable is used to create a thread, starting the thread causes the object's run method to be called in that separately executing thread.

      The general contract of the method run is that it may take any action whatsoever.

      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      See Also:
      • Thread.run()

    • markSeen

      public boolean markSeen(String userName, String gamertag)
      Marks a player as seen in the database.
      Parameters:
      userName - The player's username.
      gamertag - The player's gamertag
      Returns:
      True if player is set seen and false if it is not.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there are any issues setting the field.

    • seenToday

      public boolean seenToday(String userName, String gamertag) throws NoSuchFieldException
      Gets if a player has been seen today or not.
      Parameters:
      userName - The player's username.
      gamertag - The player's gamertag.
      Returns:
      True if they have been seen today and false if they have not.
      Throws:
      NoSuchFieldException - if the player is not in the database.
